1.title: Golf
1.author: Alex Graham.
1.series: Jan. 27, 1990) "I Lost Easily, Was Well Beaten, but it was a Lovely Day, and I Thoroughly Enjoyed It"*
notes: Summary: Fred and his mistress can't believe what they're hearing about today's golf game.

2.title: Golf
2.author: Mike Peters.
2.series: Feb. 3, 1990) "Hey, I Could Get Into Golf"
notes: Summary: Grimm is in a sand trap joyfully digging a tunnel with a golf club.

3.title: Golf
3.author: Hart.
3.series: Feb. 13, 1990) "Either a Diehard Golfer or a Talking Thermometer"*
notes: Summary: A loud "4!" sounds in the wintry night.

4.title: Golf
4.author: Moore.
4.series: Feb. 15, 1990) "OK, OK, OK, OK!! You Can Play Through!"
notes: Summary: Two golfers are tied to a stake and ready to burn.

5.title: Golf
5.author: Schulz.
5.series: Mar. 16, 1990) "He Says the Course is Too Narrow"
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown's grandpa plays golf mostly in his head

6.title: Golf
6.author: Art-Chip Sansom.
notes: Summary: Brutus hears the word "For!" and gets hit on the head with a golf ball.

7.title: Golf
7.author: Thaves.
7.series: Mar. 29, 1990) "I Got Them Out Of Your Bag"*
notes: Summary: Frank wonders how Ernie can smile when he's hit four balls into the water.

8.title: Golf
8.author: Schulz.
8.series: Apr. 26, 1990) "He Sold Me a New Golf Bag"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown hears that the pro had a suggestion for improving Snoopy's game.

9.title: Golf
9.author: Art-Chip Sansom.
notes: Summary: Brutus asks the pro how to improve his score, and the pro suggests skipping a hole.

10.title: Golf
10.author: Browne.
10.series: June 16, 1990) "I Got a Ten on the Next Hole"*
notes: Summary: Thirsty has saved the club that he got a hole in one with, in the case with his golf trophies. It's all bent up.

11.title: Golf
11.author: Browne.
11.series: June 28, 1990) "They're Great for Climbing Trees, Dad"*
notes: Summary: Hi can't find his golf shoes, and Ditto has them.

12.title: Golf
12.author: Russell Myers.
12.series: July 6, 1990) "Why Don't You Hold Your Congratulations 'til she Finishes Chewing up her Golf Ball"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda controls her temper, and doesn't destroy her club.

13.title: Golf
13.author: Moore.
13.series: July 12, 1990) "Hop Out. Your Ball Landed Right About Here"
notes: Summary: The golf cart is deep in a water hazard.

14.title: Golf
14.author: Browne.
14.series: July 21, 1990) "I Can't Use the Weather as an Excuse Not to Mow the Lawn This Morning"*
notes: Summary: Hi's mowing the lawn in the rain, so he can play golf later.

15.title: Golf
15.author: Chris Browne.
15.series: July 21, 1990) "If You Want To Tag Along, I'll Examine You at the End of Nine!"*
notes: Summary: Hagar doesn't have an appointment, and Dr. Zook is busy.

16.title: Golf
16.author: MacNelly.
16.series: July 21, 1990) "The Ones with the Golf Clubs"*
notes: Summary: Pinned down by budget cutters, the platoon has to hold its fire until they see actual politicians.

17.title: Golf
17.author: Don Addis
17.appears_in: reproduced on p. 141 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Einstein plays golf.

18.title: Golf
18.author: Dean Young & Stan Drake.
18.series: July 28, 1990) "If You Hit Your Ball Where You're Supposed To, You Would've Been Home Two Hours Ago"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood feels guilty about spending so much time away from home.

19.title: Golf
19.author: Schulz.
19.series: Aug. 7, 1990) "Golf is a Cruel Game, Charlie Brown"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown has lost Peggy Jean, and Linus says the only thing he can think of to comfort him.

20.title: Golf
20.author: Moore.
notes: Summary: A bear is selling balls, and behind him is a pile of broken golf equipment and golfers.

21.title: Golf
21.author: Young & Drake.
21.series: Sept. 1, 1990) "That's Exactly How You Look on the Golf Course"*
notes: Summary: Herb sees Dagwood on his hands and knees in his vegetable garden.

22.title: Golf
22.author: Armstrong.
22.series: Sept. 5, 1990) "Looks Like Dad Had a Bad Day at Play"*
notes: Summary: Dad's golf game did not go well.

23.title: Golf
23.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: The new golf cart improves their game.

24.title: Golf
24.author: Bittle.
notes: Summary: Artie sends a divot straight down the fairway with a 3 iron.

25.title: Golf
25.author: Hart.
25.series: Sept. 17, 1990) "Why Would They Come Up with a Silly Name Like Golf?"*
notes: Summary: The sound effect of a ball being hit is "golf".

26.title: Golf
26.author: Hart
26.appears_in: reproduced on p. 174-175 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The less I hit the ball, the better I am doing? B.C. tries to explain golf.

27.title: Golf
27.author: Art-Chip.
27.series: Sept. 27, 1990) "You Overlook the Ninth Green on the Golf Course!"*
notes: Summary: A realtor is showing a house as a ball comes through the window.

28.title: Golf
28.author: Mort Walker
28.series: Oct. 4, 1990) "What Was That Number Two Again?"*
28.appears_in: p. 62 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Mrs. Halftrack is blue, and asks if Amos loves her better than his career, or gin, or his pals, or golf.

29.title: Golf
29.author: Mort Walker.
29.series: Nov. 7, 1990) "She Wants To Know How Long She Can Shop"*
notes: Summary: Miss Buxley asks the general how long it takes to play golf.

30.title: Golf
30.author: Schulz.
30.series: Nov. 26, 1990) "How Come They Never Have a Catleg?"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown says the next hole is par four, dogleg to the right.

31.title: Golf
31.author: Mort Walker.
31.series: Dec. 12, 1990) "When It Rains He Likes to Practice Indoors"*
notes: Summary: General Halftrack uses marshmallows for golf balls on rainy days.

32.title: Golf
32.author: Russell Myers.
32.series: Dec. 14, 1990) "Golf, Tennis and Bowling All In One Day!"*

33.title: Golf
33.author: Jerry Van Amerongen
33.appears_in: reproduced on p. 162 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Hadley smashes his locker door after golf.

34.title: Golf
34.author: Bill Griffith
34.appears_in: reproduced on p. 141 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Zippy ruminates about how most major business and government decisions are made on golf courses.

35.title: Golf
35.author: Joe Martin.
notes: Summary: Boffo the astronomer finds something exciting in the sky with his telescope.

36.title: Golf
36.author: Schulz.
36.series: Feb. 6, 1991) "Forget It. The Roses are All Out of Bounds"*
notes: Summary: On the golf course, Charlie Brown tells Snoopy that Walter Hagen says to stop and smell the roses.

37.title: Golf
37.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: General Halftrack complains to the bartender about heartache, humiliation, and damage to his self-esteem.

38.title: Golf
38.author: by Bill Rechin and Don Wilder.
notes: Summary: The course is already knee-deep and it's still snowing. A snowman is holding the pin for the 7th hole.
Panel without words.

39.title: Golf
39.author: Guisewite.
39.series: Feb. 19, 1991) "What a Woman Says/What a Man Hears"*
notes: Summary: Cathy asks Irving if golf is more important to him that a little romance, and he hears it as a suggestion to go play golf.

40.title: Golf
40.author: by Bill Rechin and Don Wilder.
notes: Summary: A sign on a golf cart.

41.title: Golf
41.author: by Nash & Zullo.
notes: Summary: Dave Marr bounces a golf ball off a member of the gallery and into a sand trap, in the 1965 Bob Hope Open.

42.title: Golf
42.author: Amend.
42.series: Mar. 18, 1991) "So What'd This New Putter Cost?"*
notes: Summary: Roger feels like a new man.

43.title: Golf
43.author: by Mort Walker
43.series: Apr. 6, 1991) "I Refuse to Answer on the Grounds that my Answer Would get me Killed"*
43.appears_in: p. 112 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Mrs. Halftrack complains that Amos is gone all day when he plays golf, and asks why he doesn't take up the shorter game of tennis.

44.title: Golf
44.author: Hart.
notes: Summary: Peter is selling golf shoes, but the customer doesn't play golf.

45.title: Golf
45.author: Young & Drake.
45.series: Apr. 30, 1991) "I Think of Work and You Think of Play! That's Why I'm the Boss and You're Not!"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood proposes a game of golf, and Mr. Dithers does it without him.

46.title: Golf
46.author: by Bill Amend.
46.series: Mar. 20, 1991) "You Know, I Don't Think This Floor is Level"*
notes: Summary: Roger wants to show off his new putter, and the ball goes down the basement stairs.

47.title: Golf
47.author: by Cathy Guisewite
47.series: May 14, 1991) "Why Is It The Only Time Men Really Change It's Into Something Totally Aggravating?"*
47.appears_in: reproduced on p. 165 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Irving announces he's become a golfer.

48.title: Golf
48.author: Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Irving has finally quit working late and on weekends, and it's not to spend time with Cathy.

49.title: Golf
49.author: Guisewite.
49.series: May 17, 1991) "At Least If He Were With Another Woman I'd Understand Why He Was Enjoying Himself!"*
notes: Summary: Cathy complains about Irving and his golf.

50.title: Golf
50.author: Russell Myers
50.appears_in: reproduced on p. 139 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Gaylord describes golf to Broom-Hilda: you hit the ball into 18 holes and then you go into the bar.

52.title: Golf
52.author: Russell Myers.
52.series: May 23, 1991) "You Can Have a Ton of Fun Without Ever Hitting the Ball!"*
notes: Summary: Irwin enjoys watching Broom-Hilda try to play golf.

53.title: Golf
53.author: Russell Myers.
53.series: May 24, 1991) "It's a big Advantage When You Think High Score Wins"*
notes: Summary: Irwin doesn't get frustrated by golf.

54.title: Golf
54.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Will the playoff be sudden death, or slow death?

55.title: Golf
55.author: MacNelly.
55.series: May 29, 1991) "I Don't Hate the Game of Golf, I Hate My Game of Golf"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo explains about hating golf.

56.title: Golf
56.author: by Bill Amend
56.series: June 9, 1991) "Yous Hit My Wife Wit Da Ball!"*
56.appears_in: reproduced on p. 157 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Roger Fox is trying to select a club, and decides to use a driver.

57.title: Golf
57.author: Guisewite.
57.series: June 15, 1991) "742 Golf Courses Within a 60-Mile Radius"*
notes: Summary: Cathy has found a vacation area in California that Irving likes.

58.title: Golf
58.author: Stephen Bentley
58.series: June 18, 1991) "A Stray Ball from the Driving Range"*
58.appears_in: reproduced on p. 142 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Jamaal says Herb shouldn't be so cheap about his golf balls.

59.title: Golf
59.author: Stephen Bentley
59.series: June 19, 1991) "A Stray Ball from the Driving Range"*
59.appears_in: reproduced on p. 142 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Jamal says Herb shouldn't be so cheap about his golf balls.

60.title: Golf
60.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
60.series: July 11, 1991) "Somewhere Between Us is the Complete Experience"*
notes: Summary: Irving and Cathy have just played a round of golf, and have completely different recollections of it.

61.title: Golf
61.author: Mort Walker.
61.series: Jan. 15, 1992) "Everyone Has an Off Day Now And Then"*
notes: Summary: The general has decided to work instead of playing golf.

62.title: Golf
62.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy likes golf better the more he plays.

63.title: Golf
63.author: Young & Drake.
63.series: July 20, 1991) "A Man Needs to Get Outside and Dig Into the Earth"*
notes: Summary: A beautiful day. Blondie thinks Dagwood's talking about gardening, but he has golf in mind.

64.title: Golf
64.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy has lost a golf match to a girl sandbagger.

65.title: Golf
65.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown compliments Snoopy on his drive, that's still rolling.

66.title: Golf
66.author: by Cathy Guiswite.
66.series: July 27, 1991) "Can I Help It If Dogs are Better at Human Nature than Humans Are?"*
notes: Summary: Cathy notices how much harder she tries to please an aloof Electra, but when she tries it on Irving he heads straight to the driving range.

67.title: Golf
67.author: Wise-Aldrich.
notes: Summary: He plans to send the ball another 20 yards.

68.title: Golf
68.author: Moore.
68.series: Aug. 12, 1991) "Don't Be a Fool, Andy. Let Them Play Through"
notes: Summary: A football team is advancing across the golf course.

69.title: Golf
69.author: Moore.
69.series: Aug. 13, 1991) "Wait 20 Minutes to Digest Before You Go in the Water"*
notes: Summary: An alligator has eaten a golfer, and is warned about swimming.
Also found dated Aug. 14, 1991.

70.title: Golf
70.author: G
70.series: Aug. 17, 1991) "Well, You Didn't Have to Keep the Motor Running!"*
notes: Summary: Boopsie sends B.D. packing, and he comes back to the car with his suitcase and golf clubs.

71.title: Golf
71.author: Duffy.
71.series: Aug. 19, 1991) "I've Been Told I'm Generous to a Fault"*
notes: Summary: Al is putting, and Axel asks him what his handicap is.

72.title: Golf
72.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Irving always denies it when Cathy says he always does anything.

73.title: Golf
73.author: Guisewite.
73.series: Aug. 23, 1991) "I Have Met His Mistress, and She Wears a Little Sock on Her Head"*
notes: Summary: Irving's late going out for dinner, because he's been on the driving range for four hours with the most forgiving wood in his bag.

74.title: Golf
74.author: Hoest & Reiner.
74.series: Aug. 26, 1991) "You Never Told Me How Exciting It Is to Get a Hole in One!"*
notes: Summary: Loretta tries golf.

75.title: Golf
75.author: Young & Drake.
75.series: Aug. 26, 1991) "You Could've Played a Lot Worse"*
notes: Summary: Blondie tries to get Dagwood to look on the bright side.

76.title: Golf
76.author: Hart
76.appears_in: reproduced on p. 145 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The interviewer asks the golfer what he'll be looking for on the last day of the tournament.

77.title: Golf
77.author: by Johnny Hart.
77.series: Sept. 21, 1991) "You Get a Second Chance Coming Back"*
notes: Summary: The golfers are at the bottom edge of a steeply angled green.

78.title: Golf
78.author: Hart.
78.series: Sept. 23, 1991) "Can I Have a Mulligan on My Decision?"*
notes: Summary: The golfer and the caddy discuss the caddy's fee.

79.title: Golf
79.author: Chance Browne.
79.series: Oct. 7, 1991) "It was a Par Five. I was On in Two, and I Four-Putted!"*
notes: Summary: Hi wakes up from a nightmare.

80.title: Golf
80.author: Schulz.
80.series: Oct. 7, 1991) "It's the Only Way I Can Find My Way Back to the Clubhouse"*
notes: Summary: Snoopy leaves a trail of golf clubs.

81.title: Golf
81.author: MacNelly.
81.series: Oct. 9, 1991) "The Grunt at the End as Gotten a Whole Lot Louder"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo's golf swing has improved.

82.title: Golf
82.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Cosmo feels ridiculous, and Shoe says he's making a common mistake.

83.title: Golf
83.author: Parker.
83.series: Oct. 14, 1991) "A Smart Golf Ball that Seeks Out the Hole"*
notes: Summary: The king is interested in the wizard's new project.

84.title: Golf
84.author: Batiuk & Ayers.
notes: Summary: While leaving the course, Crankshaft takes a moment to alter the sign.

85.title: Golf
85.author: Alex Graham.
notes: Summary: In the living room, Fred's master is shouting with joy because he made a putt into a tumbler for an imaginary championship.

86.title: Golf
86.author: Bob Thaves
86.appears_in: reproduced on p. 159 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Medical students are being lectured about adversity, frustration, setbacks and catastrophe.

87.title: Golf
87.author: Parker.
87.series: Nov. 22, 1991) "Six Hundred Executioners and I Get One with a Slice!"*
notes: Summary: The king tells the executioner to open up his stance.

88.title: Golf
88.author: G
88.series: Nov. 26, 1991) "I Was Told We Were Going to Talk About Golf"*
notes: Summary: Dan Quayle doesn't want the interview to be about the DEA, Brett Kimberlin, and political damage control.

89.title: Golf
89.author: by Paul Nichols ; LeDoux and Wilson.
89.series: Jan. 15, 1992) "We Just Rejected the First One"*
notes: Summary: Mr. Baron practices golf in his office while overseeing the rejection of the St. James payroll checks.

90.title: Golf
90.author: Mort Walker.
90.series: Jan. 24, 1992) "I Hope They Never Find Out"*
notes: Summary: Halftrack heads for the golf course wondering if the Pentagon knows how much time he spends on paperwork.

91.title: Golf
91.author: Chris Browne.
91.series: Jan. 29, 1992) "It's the Only Time There Won't Be a Two-Hour Wait"*
notes: Summary: Hagar is golfing chest-deep in snow.

92.title: Golf
92.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy is lining up a tough putt, and Charlie Brown asks him how much he thinks it breaks.

93.title: Golf
93.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Summary: To the left it's a hook, and to the right it's a slice, but what about down the middle?

94.title: Golf
94.author: Larry Wright.
94.series: Mar. 20, 1992) "Golf Nuts are So Pathetic This Time of Year"
notes: Summary: Kit is standing in the snow with a golf club.

95.title: Golf
95.author: Mort Walker.
95.series: Mar. 28, 1992) "We're Pretty Sure You Won't Lose, Sir"*
notes: Summary: The General's subordinates propose betting on their golf game, even though he didn't bring enough money.

96.title: Golf
96.author: by Kevin Fagan.
96.series: Apr. 3, 1992) "It's Nice to Play With Someone Who Knows the Rule Book!"*
notes: Summary: Dad kicks his ball out of the rough onto the fairway, because Rule #314 says it's okay if he's wearing a hat.

97.title: Golf
97.author: by Millar-Hinds.
97.series: Apr. 17, 1992) "There's a Plane Out of Here at 4:20"*
notes: Summary: Players way behind in the tournament decide to hurry up and finish the round.

98.title: Golf
98.author: by Millar-Hinds.
98.series: Apr. 18, 1992) "People Paid Good Money to See Your Best Golf"*
notes: Summary: Two pros are having fun, playing as fast as they can.

99.title: Golf
99.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Cathy describes Spring, and being in love, to Irving.

100.title: Golf
100.author: Mort Walker.
100.series: Apr. 29, 1992) "The Golf Course is Closed for Repairs?"*
notes: Summary: There are messages for the General about the Pentagon, a tornado, the golf course, a tax audit, and his wife totalling the car.

101.title: Golf
101.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
101.series: Apr. 29, 1992) "When I Vowed to Stand By My Man, No One Mentioned I'd Have to be Holding Sports Equipment"*
notes: Summary: Irving has bought Cathy a set of golf clubs as a present.

102.title: Golf
102.author: Schulz
102.appears_in: reproduced on p. 126 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: As Snoopy takes his shot (Charlie Brown is the caddy), a voice is heard from off-panel. An allusion to Jack Nicklaus.

103.title: Golf
103.author: by Kevin Fagan
103.series: May 3, 1992) "How Come All Of Your Golf Balls Have Red Rings Around Them?"*
103.appears_in: reproduced on p. 170 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Norman gets a lecture on honesty.

104.title: Golf
104.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: Summary: Cathy discovers she's good at golf.

105.title: Golf
105.author: Cathy Guisewite.
105.series: May 12, 1992) "I'm Playing Golf to Help us Stay a Couple, but Not to Become a Golf Couple"*
notes: Summary: The golf game turns into an argument with Irving over whether they're a couple. Irving thinks women always turn everything into a whole different sport.

106.title: Golf
106.author: Cathy Guisewite.
106.series: May 13, 1992) "The Fine Line Between Kissing and Spitting on her Owner's Face"*
notes: Summary: Electra feels sorry for Cathy, stuck in a building all Day, but then finds out Cathy's been playing golf.

107.title: Golf
107.author: Mort Walker.
107.series: May 15, 1992) "And That's Just your Golf Swing!"*
notes: Summary: According to Mrs. Halftrack, the General is clumsy, lacking in technique, etc.

108.title: Golf
108.author: by Steve Moore
108.appears_in: reproduced on p. 166 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The golfers are getting in and out of their golf carts.

109.title: Golf
109.author: Chris Browne.
109.series: June 5, 1992) "Especially When It's the Enchanted Forest!"*
notes: Summary: Hagar and Lucky Eddie hate it when the golf ball goes into the woods.

110.title: Golf
110.author: Mort Walker
110.series: June 6, 1992) "It's Too Nice a day to Waste on War"*
110.appears_in: reproduced on p. 150 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The general has called off the maneuvers and gone golfing.

111.title: Golf
111.author: Art-Chip.
111.series: June 9, 1992) "Do Try to Pick Up the Pace, It Looks Like Rain"*
notes: Summary: Brutus is the boss's guest for a round of golf, the cart is out of gas and Brutus is pushing it.

112.title: Golf
112.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: Peter can't talk his dad into using a heaver club, fails, and ends up in the water hazard looking for the ball.

113.title: Golf
113.author: Jim Davis.
113.series: June 17, 1992) "By the Way, May I Borrow Your Golf Clubs?"*
notes: Summary: Jon gives Garfield golf clubs for his birthday, and they're not appreciated.

114.title: Golf
114.author: by Nicole Hollander.
114.series: June 17, 1992) "Secret Service Men and Blonde Guy Carrying Golf Clubs Getting Off the Elevator"*
notes: (The Dogs from Hell)
Summary: Because of his stand on the environment, the dogs have set up an indoor golf course to catch Dan Quayle.

115.title: Golf
115.author: Young & Drake.
115.series: June 20, 1992) "You Should See Me Walk 18 Holes"*
notes: Summary: The mailman doesn't play golf, but he does walk.

116.title: Golf
116.author: Jim Berry.
116.series: June 23, 1992) "Ever Since the Rio Thing, I've Been Wondering... From an Environmental Standpoint... is a Metal Wood Better than a Wood Wood?"
notes: Summary: George Bush is speaking, holding up a golf club.

117.title: Golf
117.author: Parker.
117.series: July 10, 1992) "I Thought Four Dozen Would Get Us Through the Front Nine"*
notes: Summary: The king complains that the're out of golf balls.

118.title: Golf
118.author: Art-Chip.
118.series: July 10, 1992) "You Bought Golf Clubs and Everyone Knows You Can't Play Golf"*
notes: Summary: Gladys wants to buy a tennis bracelet, and Brutus thinks she must be kidding, she doesn't play tennis.

119.title: Golf
119.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Mr. Dithers never looks at his ball before they start, so he doesn't know if the one behind the tree is his.

120.title: Golf
120.author: by Bill Watterson
120.series: July 19, 1992) "If You Don't Want to Play with Old Geezers, You Have To Make Golf a Contact Sport!"*
120.appears_in: reproduced on p. 171 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).

121.title: Golf
121.author: Chance Browne
121.series: Aug. 1, 1992) "That's One # Less than Last Week"*
121.appears_in: reproduced on p. 154 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Irma asks Thirsty how his golf game was, and he responds: *!!XX#@.

122.title: Golf
122.author: by Charles Schulz.
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown is talking to the ball that Snoopy has just hit onto the green.

123.title: Golf
123.author: Schulz.
123.series: Sept. 4, 1992) "I've Never Seen a Divot Like This Before"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown holds up an "x" shaped divot, and Snoopy thinks his swing is being criticized.

124.title: Golf
124.author: Brad Anderson.
124.series: Sept. 12, 1992) "I Don't Ever Want to See It Again!"
notes: Summary: Marmaduke retrieves a golf club from a water hazard, and its owner is ungrateful.

125.title: Golf
125.author: Hart
125.appears_in: reproduced on p. 145 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The interviewer asks a great putter how he concentrates ; the golfer pulls out earplugs.

126.title: Golf
126.author: by Wiley
126.appears_in: reproduced on p. 161 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).

127.title: Golf
127.author: Pat Brady.
127.series: Oct. 15, 1992) "Rooting for the Other Golfer, Clem?"*
notes: Summary: Clem turns the volume up on the televised golf to startle a putter.

128.title: Golf
128.author: D & R.
128.series: Oct. 21, 1992) "A Summer of Slicing Golf Balls is Starting to Pay Off"*
notes: Summary: Betty scores easily at hockey.

129.title: Golf
129.author: Thaves.
129.series: Nov. 3, 1992) "I Told You Not To Eat Lunch at a Golf Course!"*
notes: Summary: One of the anteaters has four large lumps in his snout.

130.title: Golf
130.author: by Jeff MacNelly.
130.series: Nov. 18, 1992) "Fortunately, I Can Still Outrun It"*
notes: Summary: The Professor's paperwork has caught up to him, so he leaves with his golf bag.

131.title: Golf
131.author: Thaves.
131.series: Dec. 21, 1992) "And Then They Put On Their Ugliest Clothing and Lay Their Eggs in These Little Holes"
notes: Summary: A flying saucer alien explains human reproduction at the fourth hole.

132.title: Golf
132.author: Mort Walker.
132.series: Dec. 30, 1992) "You Can't Talk Golf with a Non-Golfer"*
notes: Summary: Buxley asks Halftrack about holes in onesy, eaglets, birdlings and baggies.

133.title: Golf
133.author: Dana Summers
133.appears_in: reproduced on p. 147 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The winner of the golf tournament gets a billboard-sized check, and cashes it at the bank for equally enormous currency.

134.title: Golf
134.author: by Paul Conrad
134.appears_in: dated 1993 and reproduced on p. 167 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Cartoon shows Bill Clinton using a saxophone for a golf club.

135.title: Golf
135.author: Cullum.
135.series: Jan. 6, 1993) "The Water Hazards are Awfully Big"
notes: Summary: He's designing his dream golf course.

136.title: Golf
136.author: by Robb Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Joe's dad has taken up golf, and bought tees, balls, clubs, and shoes. Joe's mom is the shopping instructor.

137.title: Golf
137.author: by Schulz.
137.series: Jan. 22, 1993) "Do You Mind If I Play Through?"*
notes: Summary: Charlie Brown is stuck on the ice on his back like a turtle hoping someone will help him, and Snoopy comes along with his golf clubs.

138.title: Golf
138.author: Robb Armstrong
138.series: Jan. 23, 1993) "Say! Isn't That Michael Jordan with a Nine Iron?"*
138.appears_in: reproduced on p. 142 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Joe makes fun of his dad's golf outfit, then changes his mind and gets his own set of checks and stripes.

139.title: Golf
139.author: Hoest & Reiner.
139.series: Feb. 27, 1993) "Maybe Golf Would Be More Enjoyable, Leroy, If You Gave Up Keeping Score"

140.title: Golf
140.author: by Mort Walker.
140.series: Mar. 13, 1993) "It Will Prevent You from Going Out on the Course and Making a Fool of Yourself"*
notes: Summary: The General tries a new golf gadget, that straps his arms and legs to the wall.

141.title: Golf
141.author: by Bill Amend.
141.series: Mar. 19, 1993) "You Know, We Could Practice Outside"*
notes: Summary: Marcus and Jason are trying golf, and the walls and ceiling of Jason's room are stuck full of clubs.

142.title: Golf
142.author: Mort Walker.
142.series: Mar. 23, 1993) "It's 30 Degrees Out There! Don't Tell Me You're Playing Golf!"*
notes: Summary: The General is all bundled up to go out.

143.title: Golf
143.author: Hoest & Reiner.
143.series: Mar. 27, 1993) "Why Does His Hit Go Crack, While Yours Just Goes Clunk?"*
notes: Summary: Loretta wonders about the sounds at the driving range.

144.title: Golf
144.author: Jim Berry.
144.series: Mar. 31, 1993) "He's Been a Member of a Whacko Religious Cult for Years. They're Not Dangerous, Though. They Play Golf"

145.title: Golf
145.author: by Dan Piraro.
145.series: Apr. 3, 1993) "I Told You I Heard Somebody Yell Fore!"*
notes: Summary: A golf ball lands by the castaways on a tiny island.

146.title: Golf
146.author: by Stephen Bentley.
146.series: Apr. 5, 1993) "This is What I'll Need to Play Eighteen Holes of Golf"*
notes: Summary: Jamaal gets a bucket of balls.

147.title: Golf
147.author: by Dan Piraro.
notes: Summary: A golfer asks his caddy for a club.

148.title: Golf
148.author: by John McPherson
148.appears_in: reproduced on p. 166 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Shown: An exercise machine for the golf swing.

149.title: Golf
149.author: Chris Browne.
149.series: Apr. 19, 1993) "I Said, Mind If We Play Through?"*
notes: Summary: Golfers come upon Hagar in the midst of a battle.

150.title: Golf
150.author: by Bill Amend.
150.series: Apr. 23, 1993) "I Did Hit the 200-Yard Marker with my Five Iron"*
notes: Summary: Roger had a mixed experience on the driving range; he still has the grip to his five iron.

151.title: Golf
151.author: by Robb Armstrong.
151.series: Apr. 28, 1993) "They Said the Same Thing to George Foreman!"*
notes: Summary: Joe's dad is thinking of coming out of retirement, and Joe tells him to take up golf.

152.title: Golf
152.author: by Schulz.
152.series: Apr. 29, 1993) "And the Prophet Said They Would Beat Their Swords into Golf Clubs"*
notes: Summary: Peppermint Patty doesn't think you could play 18 holes with a plowshare.

153.title: Golf
153.author: Alex Graham.
153.series: Apr. 30, 1993) "He's Been Elected Captain of the Club!"*
notes: Summary: Fred is elated that they're parking at a reserved spot at the golf club, but it's a mistake.

154.title: Golf
154.author: by Paul Nichols ; LeDoux and Wilson.
154.series: May 8, 1993) "Quiet, Ruth. This Putt's for All the Marbles at Pebble Beach!"*
notes: Summary: The girls say goodbye to Grandpa at the cemetery; meanwhile Mr. Cabot practices putting indoors.

155.title: Golf
155.author: Wise-Aldrich.
155.series: May 8, 1993) "Spring. That Wonderful Time of Year When the Leaves and the Golfers Return to the Trees"

156.title: Golf
156.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Hagar has destroyed his whole set of clubs, including one wrapped around Lucky Eddie's neck.

157.title: Golf
157.author: Bittle.
157.series: May 15, 1993) "At the Bottom of the Water Hazard on the 15th Hole"*
notes: Summary: Artie wants to return the clubs he bought last week, and he does know where they are.

158.title: Golf
158.author: Alex Graham.
158.series: May 15, 1993) "Me Left at Home Here, and Them Out Enjoying Themselves on the Golf Course"*
notes: Summary: Fred's master and mistress come home arguing about the golf game.

159.title: Golf
159.author: by Paul Nichols ; Le Doux and Wilson.
159.series: May 18, 1993) "Tell Me, Are the Girls There With You?"*
notes: Summary: Roger Cabot, golf club in hand, calls in response to Ezra Barton's death.

160.title: Golf
160.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Another golfer shouts, 'Aft!' and Hagar gets bonked with a ball.

161.title: Golf
161.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Hagar is returning late from golf, and Lucky Eddie helps him read the situation at home.

162.title: Golf
162.author: Chance Browne.
162.series: June 12, 1993) "The Spaces for Your Handicap are Way Down at the Far End"*
notes: Summary: Thurston has parked in handicapped parking, and is told to move.

163.title: Golf
163.author: Schulz.
163.series: June 16, 1993) "Then They Said Dogs Aren't Allowed on the Course"*
notes: Summary: Spike went into town with his golf clubs and they asked what his handicap was, and he said his handicap was that he's a dog.

164.title: Golf
164.author: by Joe Martin.
164.series: July 5, 1993) "Forget the Flag on the Hill! I'll be Lucky if I can Get the Straggler with the Funny Hat!"*
notes: (People Unclear on the Concept)
Summary: Mr. Boffo is getting ready to drive his golf ball.

165.title: Golf
165.author: Bil Keane.
notes: Summary: Hit the ball, shake your head, say 'Oh, no, no!'

166.title: Golf
166.author: MacNelly
166.series: July 10, 1993) "Neither Rain, Nor Snow, Nor Dark of Night, Will Stay a Plugger from his Appointed Round"
166.appears_in: reproduced on p. 149 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Pluggers play golf.

167.title: Golf
167.author: Richard Guindon.
167.series: July 15, 1993) "Have You Been Following What the Mississippi Did to Those Golf Courses?"*
notes: Summary: Golfers talk about the news.

168.title: Golf
168.author: Unger.
168.series: July 17, 1993) "Sorry About Your Eye. Did You See Where the Ball Went?"
notes: Summary: A golfer has hit a man with his ball.

169.title: Golf
169.author: by Paul Nichols ; LeDoux and Wilson.
169.series: July 19, 1993) "We Might As Well Amuse Ourselves!"*
notes: Summary: Biff sets Sam up for a round of golf on the island.

170.title: Golf
170.author: by Steve Moore
170.appears_in: reproduced on p. 160 Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Golfers leave their cart for one hole and return to find it stripped.

171.title: Golf
171.author: by Paul Nichols ; LeDoux and Wilson.
notes: Summary: Mrs. Cabot takes a golf cart to catch her son at the eighth hole.

172.title: Golf
172.author: by Joe Martin.
172.series: July 30, 1993) "The Right Prison Can Take Three Strokes Off Your Game!"*
notes: Summary: The lawyer tries to help his client see the bright side.

173.title: Golf
173.author: Mort Walker.
173.series: July 31, 1993) "Golfers Only Keep Their Good Scores, Right?"*
notes: Summary: Mrs. Halftrack wonders why there's only one score card in the General's drawer.

174.title: Golf
174.author: by Paul Nichols ; LeDoux and Wilson.
174.series: July 31, 1993) "Shouldn't We Tell Roger I'm Going Back to the Clubhouse, Mrs. Cabot?"*
notes: Summary: A search on the golf course.

175.title: Golf
175.author: Young & Drake.
175.series: July 31, 1993) "Wait'll He Sees the New Numbers on his Paycheck!"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood insists on arguing about the boss's score, because he's good with numbers.

176.title: Golf
176.author: Alex Graham.
176.series: July 31, 1993) "We Have Trouble With Rabbits on This Course"*
notes: Summary: Fred's master's ball has gone into a rabbit hole.

177.title: Golf
177.author: Alex Graham.
177.series: Aug. 13, 1993) "I Might Have Caught That Rabbit if I Hadn't Been Lumbered With This Lot"*
notes: Summary: Fred chases a rabbit, and pulls his master's golf bag, across the golf course.

178.title: Golf
178.author: Olson & Kelso.
178.series: Aug. 13, 1993) "You'll Successfully Steer Clear of Obstacle and Then It's Downhill All the Way!"
notes: Summary: To avoid hitting rabbits on the bridge, the golf cart ends up in the water hazard.

179.title: Golf
179.author: Armstrong.
179.series: Aug. 16, 1993) "I See Jeff Threw His Back Out Again Playing Golf"*

180.title: Golf
180.author: by Joe Martin
180.series: Aug. 21, 1993) "The Dark Side of Genetic Engineering"
180.appears_in: reproduced on p. 163 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Situation: The golf ball is sentient.

181.title: Golf
181.author: Chance Browne.
181.series: Aug. 21, 1993) "Reverend MacDuff Invited Me to Play Golf With Him Right After the Service"*
notes: Summary: Hi explains taking his golf bag to church.

182.title: Golf
182.author: by Janet Alfieri and Ed Colley.
182.series: Aug. 31, 1993) "Want Me To Tell You What You're Doing Wrong, Bob?"*
notes: Summary: Bob's golf isn't going well, but he doesn't want advice.

183.title: Golf
183.author: Wise-Aldrich.
notes: Summary: She's keeping score (golf), and asks him if he ever found his ball.

184.title: Golf
184.author: Larry Wright.
184.series: Sept. 9, 1993) "I Look On Him as the Indoor Equivalent to a Sand Trap"
notes: Summary: Kit is doing some putting practice, and Carlyle watches the ball attentively.

185.title: Golf
185.author: Joe Martin.
185.series: Sept. 17, 1993) "I Think I Ate One of the Balls By Mistake"*
notes: Summary: Willy describes his round of golf in terms of the food consumed, but it wasn't all good.

186.title: Golf
186.author: by Johnny Hart.
notes: Summary: It's 200 yards to the green for Grog, but his drive overshoots by a similar distance.

187.title: Golf
187.author: by Johnny Hart.
187.series: Sept. 21, 1993) "Grog's Third Shot Made the Pond, Folks"*
notes: Summary: Grog drinks the water hazard to get to his ball.

188.title: Golf
188.author: by Nicole Hollander
188.series: Sept. 23, 1993) "Someday, It'll Be the Same with Bikini Waxing"*
188.appears_in: reproduced on p. 139 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Series: Gender Chats.
Summary: Describes how businessmen return each other's calls after they've played golf together.

189.title: Golf
189.author: by Johnny Hart.
189.series: Sept. 24, 1993) "He's Got One of Those 'Big Head' Clubs, hasn't he?"*
notes: Summary: They find Grog's drive, and it's all flattened out.

190.title: Golf
190.author: Bittle.
190.series: Sept. 25, 1993) "It Was Either That or Wade in and Get Them Myself"*
notes: Summary: Artie gave away his golf clubs.

191.title: Golf
191.author: Parker.
191.series: Sept. 25, 1993) "You Can Start by Using a Pull Cart When You Play Golf"*
notes: Summary: The doctor tells the king to get more exercise.

192.title: Golf
192.author: by Johnny Hart.
192.series: Sept. 27, 1993) "It Takes Me 17 Holes to Get Over Paying a Week's Salary for the Greens Fee and a Cart"*
notes: Summary: He only ever plays well on the 18th hole.

193.title: Golf
193.author: by Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Killer was looking for Beetle's golf ball in the woods.

194.title: Golf
194.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda floats across the water hazard on her golf bag.

195.title: Golf
195.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy throws his golf club into the water, and it rises to the surface.

196.title: Golf
196.author: by Joe Martin.
196.series: Oct. 28, 1993) "Arnold Palmer, Jack Nicklaus, Lee Trevino and Sam Snead in Hell"
notes: Summary: They're playing miniature golf.

197.title: Golf
197.author: Nicole Hollander.
197.series: Nov. 3, 1993) "You Don't Know What 'Par' Is, Do You?"*
notes: (Bad Girl Chats)
Summary: Discussion of sex with movie stars versus shooting par.

198.title: Golf
198.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
198.series: Dec. 21, 1993) "I'm Desperate and it has 'Golf' on it"*
notes: Summary: Cathy is in the golf gifts section, buying special golf balls and clothes, a book, a mug, a plaque, a waffle iron, etc.

199.title: Golf
199.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Lt. Fuzz, the apple polisher, has been in the General's office.

200.title: Golf
200.author: Chris Browne.
200.series: Jan. 6, 1994) "Could You Take a Look at my Swing?"*
notes: Summary: Hagar's slicing everything, and fights his way across Scotland to a golf pro.

201.title: Golf
201.author: by Eric Olson and Susan Kelso.
201.series: Feb. 2, 1994) "Having Too Many Irons in the Fire Could Prove Costly!"
notes: Summary: A man is throwing golf clubs into a burning landfill.

202.title: Golf
202.author: by Bill Amend.
202.series: Mar. 12, 1994) "No Wonder Golf Tournaments Take Whole Weekends to Complete"*
notes: Summary: Jason and Marcus have scored 80 and 84 respectively on one hole of miniature golf.

203.title: Golf
203.author: Wise-Aldrich.
203.series: Mar. 12, 1994) "You Don't Know What You're Doing, but at Least You Look Good"
notes: Summary: He's dangling his putter over his ball on the green.

204.title: Golf
204.author: by John McPherson.
notes: Summary: He drives the ball and it hits him in the back of the head.

205.title: Golf
205.author: by Chip Dunham.
205.series: Mar. 24, 1994) "Just Halt the Chase and Stop all the Bouncing and Bumping?"*
notes: Summary: Although the prey looks rich and easy to catch, the pirate captain is putting into a tumbler in his cabin.

206.title: Golf
206.author: by Jim Davis.
206.series: Mar. 24, 1994) "We Walk Across Him in Golf Shoes"*
notes: Summary: Garfield shows how to wake someone up.

207.title: Golf
207.author: D&R.
notes: Summary: Too much tension on the backswing, Dad's trying to kill the button.
Key words: Video games, swings, thumbs.

208.title: Golf
208.author: Mort Walker.
208.series: Apr. 20, 1994) "I Love to See the Veins Stand Out on His Forehead"*
notes: Summary: The General comes back to the office and says his golf game was rained out.

209.title: Golf
209.author: Mort Walker.
209.series: Apr. 30, 1994) "They Have Oversized Tennis Rackets and Oversized Golf Clubs, Don't They?"*
notes: Summary: Sarge is objecting to the size of Beetle's ping-pong paddle.

210.title: Golf
210.author: Hart.
notes: Summary: Grog has a new golf club.

211.title: Golf
211.author: Chris Browne.
notes: Summary: Lucky Eddy really likes golf.

212.title: Golf
212.author: Mort Walker.
212.series: May 7, 1994) "It's About Time Golf Started Catching Up with Hockey"*
notes: Summary: Sarge and Beetle are watching televised golf, and there's a fight going on.

213.title: Golf
213.author: Unger.
213.series: May 10, 1994) "Can You Fix Them By Saturday? I'm in the Finals"
notes: Summary: A man has three badly twisted golf clubs.

214.title: Golf
214.author: by Millar-Hinds.
214.series: May 27, 1994) "Have You Noticed the Gallery that John Daly Attracts?"*
notes: Summary: Young people are watching golf and cheering.

215.title: Golf
215.author: Young & Drake.
215.series: June 21, 1994) "I Have to Work on the McNutley Contract"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood asks the boss to be a fourth for golf on Saturday, and ends up working while the boss plays.

216.title: Golf
216.author: by Bill Amend.
216.series: June 24, 1994) "My Question Is How Can You Love Golf So Much?!"*
notes: Summary: Andy hates golf and still beats Roger; he wonders why she hates it so much. A caddy approaches with one of Roger's bent and twisted clubs.

217.title: Golf
217.author: Armstrong.
217.series: June 29, 1994) "A Woman Won Her Lawsuit Against a Country Club to End Discrimination Toward Women in Choosing Tee Times!"*

218.title: Golf
218.author: Olson & Kelso.
218.series: July 6, 1994) "Get Together with a Few Good Friends and Set Off in Search of Adventure!"
notes: Summary: Four men are in the rough looking for their golf balls.

219.title: Golf
219.author: Schulz.
notes: Summary: Snoopy sinks his putt, throws his ball and gets a hail of balls in return.
Silent strip.

220.title: Golf
220.author: Ramzah.
220.series: July 30, 1994) "The Next Time She Kicks You Out Be Sure She's Not Wearing Golf Shoes"
notes: Summary: The doctor has advice.

221.title: Golf
221.author: by Stephen Bentley.
221.series: Aug. 16, 1994) "The Reason I've Been Meaning to Give Up This Game"*
notes: Summary: On the golf course, Herb is remembering something.

222.title: Golf
222.author: by Eric Olson and Susan Kelso.
222.series: Aug. 17, 1994) "A Hobby Could Prove Expensive Albeit Fulfilling!"
notes: Summary: A bag of golf clubs is shown sinking through water.

223.title: Golf
223.author: by Stephen Bentley.
223.series: Aug. 17, 1994) "I Got an Eagle, Two Birdies, a Couple of Pigeons and a Squirrel"*
notes: Summary: Herb reports his golf score.

224.title: Golf
224.author: by Millar-Hinds.
224.series: Aug. 23, 1994) "You Aren't Understanding What I Mean by 'Hate.' I Hate Golf"*
notes: Summary: Joyce has a first-woman-ever vice presidency, which includes membership fees at her golf club.

225.title: Golf
225.author: by Millar-Hinds.
225.series: Sept. 2, 1994) "Has Anything Good Ever Happened to me on a Golf Course?"*
notes: Summary: Joyce and Tank are both in the woods looking for their balls, about to meet.

226.title: Golf
226.author: by Kevin Fagan
226.series: Sept. 11, 1994) "It Probably Doesn't Make Much Difference, Since Your First Shot Only Went Twelve Feet!"*
226.appears_in: Sunday strip reprinted on p. 58 of Son of Drabble (New York : NBM, 1997)
notes: Summary: Norman asks for help in deciding which golf club to use next.

227.title: Golf
227.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Thirsty ready to walk off the course, but he stops to give Hi advice on his swing.

228.title: Golf
228.author: by Dean Young and Stan Drake.
228.series: Sept. 24, 1994) "It's the Only Time All Week I Feel Superior to Anybody"*
notes: Summary: A round takes forever, but Herb likes playing with Mr. Dithers, who takes five or six putts every green and sends half his drives into the woods.

229.title: Golf
229.author: Jim Berry.
notes: Summary: Bill Clinton contemplates a stack of papers and imagines himself playing golf.
Panel without words.

230.title: Golf
230.author: by Millar-Hinds.
notes: Summary: Masters tournament officials are trying to hire the Lion King as a golf commentator, to make it sound sacred.
Entry for: James Earl Jones.

231.title: Golf
231.author: by Dean Young and Stan Drake
231.appears_in: reproduced on p. 143 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Mr. Dithers needs Dagwood to work on Sunday, and Dagwood doesn't want to disappoint the rest of his foursome for golf.

232.title: Golf
232.author: by John McPherson.
232.series: Oct. 28, 1994) "Kevin Finally Found a Way to Keep his Head Down When he Swings"
notes: Summary: A golfer has a cement block suspended from his head.

233.title: Golf
233.author: Chance Browne.
notes: Summary: Hi and Thirsty see a snowflake on the golf course.
